It belongs to the family Aristolochiaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces a distinctive, tuberous root system that is often used in traditional medicine. Asarum ruthii thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories at high elevations.
